Buddha's disciple!
What is the mirage-like forbearance of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva knows that all worlds are the same as mirages.

It is like a mirage, having no location, neither internal nor external, neither existent nor nonexistent, neither annihilated nor eternal, neither a single color nor various colors, and also not without color, but only following worldly speech to reveal and demonstrate.
The bodhisattva thus observes in reality, understands all dharmas, realizes all, and causes them to be perfected.
This is called:
the fifth mirage-like forbearance of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the dream-like forbearance of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva knows that all worlds are like dreams.

It is like a dream, neither worldly nor apart from the world, neither the desire realm, the form realm, nor the formless realm, neither arising nor perishing, neither defiled nor pure, yet manifesting.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. They know that all worlds are the same as dreams, because there is no change, because of the nature of dreams, because of attachment to dreams, because of the nature of dreams, because of the inherent nature of dreams, because of what is manifested in dreams, because of the absence of distinctions in dreams, because of the conceptualization of dreams, and because of the time of awakening from dreams.
This is called:
The sixth forbearance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, which is like a dream.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the forbearance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas that is like an echo?
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva hears the Buddha's teachings, observes the nature of dharmas, cultivates and attains accomplishment, and reaches the other shore;
Knowing that all sounds are the same as echoes, without coming or going, they manifest in this way.
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva observes the TathÄgata's voice, which does not come from within, does not come from without, and also does not come from within and without;
Although understanding that this voice is neither internal, nor external, nor both internal and external, they are able to manifest skillful names and phrases, accomplishing the teaching.
It is like an echo, arising from conditions, yet without contradicting the nature of dharmas, enabling sentient beings to understand according to their kind and to cultivate and study.
Like Åšakra's wife, the asura woman named
ÅšacÄ«, who emits a thousand kinds of sounds from a single sound, and does not mentally think to make it come out like this.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this. Entering the realm of non-discrimination, accomplishing skillful sounds according to kind, in the boundless worlds, they always turn the wheel of the Dharma.

This bodhisattva is well able to observe all sentient beings and expound the Dharma for them with his broad and long tongue. His voice is unobstructed, pervading lands in the ten directions, causing them to hear the Dharma differently according to their inclinations;
Although knowing that sound has no origination, he universally manifests sounds; although knowing that there is nothing to be said, he extensively expounds all dharmas;
His wondrous voice is impartial, and each being understands according to their kind, all of which he is able to comprehend with wisdom.
This is called:
The seventh acceptance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas as an echo.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the acceptance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas as a reflection?
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is not born in the world, nor does he perish in the world;
He is not within the world, nor is he outside the world;
He does not practice in the world, nor does he not practice in the world;
He is not the same as the world, nor is he different from the world;
He does not go to the world, nor does he not go to the world;
Not abiding in the world, yet not not abiding in the world;
Not worldly, yet not beyond the world;
Not practicing bodhisattva conduct, yet not abandoning great vows;
Not real, yet not unreal.
Although always practicing all Buddha-dharmas, one is able to accomplish all worldly matters, not following worldly currents, yet also not dwelling in the current of the Dharma.
It is like the images of the sun, moon, men, women, houses, mountains, forests, rivers, springs, and so forth, appearing in clear substances such as oil, water, the body, jewels, and bright mirrors.

The images are neither the same as nor different from the oil, etc., neither separate nor combined, not drifting along in the flowing water, yet not sinking in the pools and wells. Although appearing within them, they are not attached to anything.
However, sentient beings know that the images appear in this place, and also know that in that place there are no such images;
Although distant and near objects are all reflected, the reflections do not follow the objects in being near or far.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. They are able to know that their own bodies and the bodies of others are all within the realm of wisdom. They do not make dualistic distinctions, thinking of self and other as separate, but each and every one, at the same time, universally manifests in their own lands and in the lands of others.
Within a seed there are no roots, sprouts, stems, nodes, branches, or leaves, yet it is able to give rise to such things.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. Within the non-dual Dharma they distinguish the two characteristics, skillfully and unobstructedly penetrating them.
This is called:
The eighth forbearance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, that of being like a reflection.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who accomplish this forbearance, although not going to the lands in the ten directions, are able to universally manifest in all buddha-lands;
Neither leaving this nor reaching that, like a reflection appearing everywhere, their practice is unobstructed;

Causing sentient beings to see different bodies, the same as the solid characteristics of the world. However, these differences are not different, and differences and non-differences are unobstructed.
This bodhisattva is born from the TathÄgata's lineage, and their body, speech, and mind are pure and unobstructed, thus they are able to attain a body with boundless pure characteristics.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's forbearance of being like an apparition?
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva knows that all worlds are entirely like apparitions.
Namely:
The mental activities of all sentient beings are apparitions, arising from conceptual thoughts;
All worldly practices are apparitions, arising from discrimination;
All suffering, happiness, and delusions are apparitions, arising from false grasping;
All unreal dharmas in the world are apparitions, manifested by speech;
All afflictions are transformations of discrimination, arising from thoughts and memories;
There are also pure and disciplined transformations, manifested without discrimination;
Transformations that do not turn in the three times, because they are equal to the unborn;
Transformations of the bodhisattva's vow power, because of extensive practice;
Transformations of the TathÄgata's great compassion, because they are expediently manifested;
Transformations of the skillful means of turning the Dharma wheel, because they are spoken with wisdom, fearlessness, and eloquence.

The bodhisattva thus understands worldly and transcendent transformations, realizes them, broadly understands them, understands them without limit, understands them as they are, understands them with mastery, truly understands them, and is unshakable by false views. He practices in the world without losing it.
It is like a transformation, which does not arise from the mind, does not arise from mental factors, does not arise from karma,
Does not experience karmic retribution, is not born in the world, does not perish in the world, cannot be followed,
It cannot be grasped or touched, not abiding for a long time or a short while, not going through the world or
departing from the world, not confined to one direction, not belonging to all directions, not having measure
or being immeasurable, neither weary nor at rest, neither not weary nor not at rest, neither ordinary nor holy,
neither defiled nor pure, neither born nor dead, neither wise nor foolish, neither seeing
nor not seeing, neither relying on the world nor entering the Dharma realm, neither wise
nor dull, neither accepting nor not accepting, neither birth and death nor nirvana, neither existent
nor nonexistent.
Bodhisattvas skillfully use such expedient means to practice the bodhisattva path in the world, understanding worldly dharmas and transforming themselves to go everywhere;
They are not attached to the world, do not grasp at their own bodies, and do not discriminate between the world and the body;
They do not dwell in the world, yet are not apart from the world;
They do not abide in the Dharma, nor do they depart from the Dharma;
By the power of their original vows, they do not abandon a single realm of sentient beings, and do not tame a small realm of sentient beings.
They do not discriminate the Dharma;

It is not that they do not discriminate, knowing the nature of all dharmas to be neither coming nor going, although they are nonexistent, they fully perfect the Buddha Dharma, understanding that dharmas are like illusions, neither existent nor nonexistent.
Buddha's disciple!
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thus abides in the forbearance of being like an illusion, they are able to fully perfect the path to the enlightenment of all buddhas and benefit sentient beings.
This is called:
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's ninth forbearance of being like an illusion.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who accomplish this forbearance are all the same as transformations. It is like a magically created person, who in all buddha-lands has no basis for abiding, in all worlds has no attachment, in all buddha-dharmas does not give rise to discrimination, yet without indolence proceeds to buddha-bodhi, cultivates bodhisattva practices, and is free from inversions. Although without a body, it manifests all bodies. Although without abiding, it abides in various lands. Although without form, it universally manifests various forms. Although not attached to the ultimate reality, it illuminates the equality and perfect fullness of the nature of dharmas.
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva has no basis for abiding in any dharmas, and is called:
The liberated one;
Having completely abandoned all faults, he is called:
The tamed one;
Without moving or turning, he universally enters the assemblies of all tathÄgatas, and is called:
The one with spiritual powers;
Having attained skillfulness in the Dharma of non-arising, he is called:
means without regression;
endowed with all powers, Mount Sumeru and the Iron Encircling Mountains cannot obstruct, called:
means without obstruction.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's forbearance of emptiness?
Buddha's disciple!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva understands that all dharma realms are like empty space, because they are without characteristics;
all worlds are like empty space, because they are without arising;
all dharmas are like empty space, because they are non-dual;
all sentient beings' practices are like empty space, because they are without practice;ğŸ”½all buddhas are like empty space, because they are without discrimination;
all buddha powers are like empty space, because they are without distinction;
all meditative absorptions are like empty space, because the three times are equal;
all dharmas that are spoken of are like empty space, because they cannot be spoken of;
all buddha bodies are like empty space, because they are without attachment and obstruction.
Bodhisattvas are like this, using space-like skillful means to understand that all phenomena are non-existent.
Buddha's disciple!

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas use space-like acceptance and wisdom to understand all phenomena, they attain a body and physical actions like space, attain speech and verbal actions like space, and attain a mind and mental actions like space.
It is like space, which is the support of all phenomena and is unborn and undying;
bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this, with all their Dharma bodies unborn and undying.
It is like space, which cannot be destroyed;
bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this, with their wisdom and powers indestructible.
It is like space, which is the support of the entire world but has no support itself;
bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this, being the support of all phenomena but having no support themselves.
It is like empty space, which is unborn and unceasing, yet can contain the birth and death of all worlds;
In the same way, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also without direction and attainment, yet can demonstrate direction and attainment, universally causing the world to cultivate and purify.
It is like empty space, which has no sides or corners, yet can manifest boundless sides and corners;
In the same way, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also without karma and retribution, yet can manifest various karmic retributions.
It is like empty space, which is neither walking nor staying, yet can manifest various deportments;
In the same way, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also neither walking nor staying, yet can discern all practices.
It is like empty space, which is neither form nor not form, yet can manifest various forms;
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. They are not worldly forms, nor are they supramundane forms, yet they are able to manifest all forms.
It is like space, which is neither long nor near, yet it is able to abide for a long time, manifesting all things;
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. They are neither long nor near, yet they are able to abide for a long time, revealing the practices carried out by bodhisattvas.
It is like space, which is neither pure nor defiled, yet is not apart from purity and defilement;
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. They are neither obstructed nor unobstructed, yet are not apart from obstruction and non-obstruction.
It is like space, which appears before all worlds, yet does not appear before all worlds;
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. All dharmas appear before them, yet all dharmas do not appear before them.
It is like space, which pervades everything, yet has no boundaries;
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this, universally entering all dharmas, while the bodhisattva mind has no boundaries.
Why is this?
Because what bodhisattvas do is like empty space.
That is to say, all cultivation, all adornment and purification, all accomplishment are all equal, of one essence, one flavor, one kind, with a magnitude like empty space, pure and all-pervading.

Thus, they realize and know all dharmas, and with regard to all dharmas have no discrimination. They adorn and purify all buddha-lands, perfect all bodies that are without support, understand all directions without confusion, possess all powers that cannot be destroyed, fulfill all boundless merits, have already reached the place of all profound dharmas, penetrate the path of all pÄramitÄs, universally sit on all vajra seats, universally emit all sounds according to type, and for all worlds turn the wheel of Dharma without ever missing the right time.
This is called:
The tenth forbearance of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas that is like space.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who accomplish this forbearance attain a body without coming, because it has no going;ğŸ”½They attain a body without birth, because it has no cessation;
They attain a body without movement, because it has no destruction;
They attain a body that is not real, because it is free from falsehood;
They attain a body of one characteristic, because it has no characteristics;
They attain an immeasurable body, because the Buddha's powers are immeasurable;
They attain an impartial body, because it is the same as the characteristic of thusness;
They attain a body without distinctions, because they equally contemplate the three times;
They attain a body that reaches everywhere, because their pure eyes equally illuminate without obstruction;
They attain a body that is free from the limit of desire, because they know that all dharmas have no combination or dispersion;
They attain a body with the limit of space, because their store of merit is inexhaustible like space;

They attain the body of unobstructed and inexhaustible Dharma-nature and equal eloquence, knowing that the characteristics of all dharmas are only one characteristic, which is the nature of no nature like space;
They attain the body of immeasurable unobstructed sounds, because they are unobstructed like space;
They attain the body of bodhisattva practices that are fully endowed with all skillful means and purity, because they are unobstructed in all places like space;
They attain the body of the successive continuation of all Buddha Dharmas, because they are unceasing like space;
They attain the body that manifests immeasurable buddha lands in all buddha lands, because they are free from all attachments like the boundless space;
They attain the body that demonstrates all sovereign dharmas without rest, because like the great ocean of space there is no limit;
They attain the body of all indestructible firm power, because like space it supports all worlds;
Attaining faculties that are clear and sharp, a body as solid and indestructible as vajra, like space that cannot be burned by the fires of all kalpas;
Attaining a body that upholds the power of all worlds, with the power of wisdom like space.
Buddha's disciple!
These are called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's ten kinds of patience.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva MahÄsattva, wanting to restate its meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
It is like a person in the world who hears of the location of a treasure trove,
Because it can be obtained, their mind gives rise to great joy.
In this way, the bodhisattva, true child of the Buddha with great wisdom,
Listens to the buddhas' teachings, the characteristics of profound quiescence.
When hearing this profound teaching, their mind attains peace,
Not startled, not frightened, also not giving rise to fear.
The great being seeking enlightenment, hearing this vast sound,
With a pure mind, one is able to endure, without doubt or confusion in this.
Thinking to oneself, Having heard this profound and subtle Dharma,
One will attain omniscience and become a great guide for humans and gods.
When bodhisattvas hear this sound, their minds greatly rejoice,
Giving rise to a firm resolve, aspiring to seek the Buddha's teachings.
Because of delighting in enlightenment, their minds gradually become subdued,
Causing their faith to increase and grow, without any opposition or slander towards the Dharma.
Therefore, hearing this sound, their minds are able to endure,
Abiding peacefully without moving, practicing the bodhisattva's conduct.
In order to seek enlightenment, they single-mindedly practice and head towards that path,
Vigorously advancing without turning back, not abandoning the yoke of various good deeds.
In seeking enlightenment, their minds are without fear,
Hearing the Dharma, they increase in courage and vigor, making offerings to the Buddha and delighting him.
It is like a person with great merit who obtains a treasure of true gold,
And according to what is suitable for the body, creates ornaments.
The bodhisattva is also like this. Having heard this profound meaning,
Contemplating it increases the ocean of wisdom, and by cultivation, one accords with the Dharma.
Knowing that dharmas exist is also in accordance with knowing, and knowing that dharmas do not exist is also in accordance with knowing.
In accordance with those dharmas, in this way, one knows all dharmas in this way.
Accomplishing a pure mind, clear and penetrating, with great joy,
Knowing dharmas arise from conditions, one diligently cultivates and practices.
Equally contemplating all dharmas, understanding their intrinsic nature,
Not contradicting the treasury of the Buddha's teachings, universally awakening to all dharmas.
The aspiration always firm, purifying the Buddha's enlightenment,
Unmoving like Mount Sumeru, single-mindedly seeking perfect enlightenment.
Having given rise to the intention of diligence, further cultivating the path of samÄdhi,
For countless eons, they diligently practice without ever regressing.
The Dharma that bodhisattvas enter is the place where the Buddha practices.
If one can understand this, their mind will be free from weariness.
As the unequaled one has said, equally observe all dharmas.
If one cannot attain impartial forbearance, one cannot accomplish impartial wisdom.
In accordance with the Buddha's teachings, accomplish this gate of forbearance.
Understand the Dharma as it is, and also do not discriminate the Dharma.
Among the thirty-three heavens, all the celestial sons
Together eat from the same vessel, but what they eat is not the same.
The various foods they eat do not come from the ten directions.
In accordance with the karma they cultivate, they are all naturally present in the vessel.
Bodhisattvas are also like this, observing all dharmas.
They all arise from causes and conditions, without arising, therefore without ceasing.
Because there is no cessation, there is no end; because there is no end, there is no defilement.
In the changing phenomena of the world, one understands there is no change;
Without change, there is no location; without location, there is quiescent extinction.
The mind is unattached and defiled, vowing to deliver all beings.
Single-mindedly contemplating the Buddha's teachings, never distracted,
Yet with a mind of compassion and vows, skillfully practicing in the world.
Diligent in seeking the ten powers, dwelling in the world without abiding,
Without going or coming, skillfully expounding the Dharma.
This forbearance is supreme, understanding the Dharma is inexhaustible;
Entering the true Dharma realm, in reality there is nothing to enter.
Bodhisattvas dwelling in this forbearance universally see all TathÄgatas,
Simultaneously receiving their predictions, this is called receiving the Buddha's office.
Comprehending the phenomena of the three times, the characteristics of quiescent purity,
Yet able to transform sentient beings, placing them in the good destinies.
The various dharmas of the world, all are like illusions,
If one is able to know this, their mind is unmoved.
All karmas arise from the mind, therefore the mind is said to be like an illusion,
If one is apart from this discrimination, universally extinguishing all destinies.
Just as a skilled magician universally manifests various forms,
In vain causing the multitude to crave and enjoy, ultimately nothing is obtained.
The world is also like this, all are like illusions,
Without nature and without arising, manifesting various things.
Liberating all sentient beings, causing them to know the dharmas are like illusions,
Sentient beings are not different from illusions, understanding illusions have no sentient beings.
Sentient beings and lands, dharmas of the three times,
Like this, without remainder, all are like illusions.
Creating illusory forms of men and women, elephants, horses, cows, and sheep,
Houses, ponds, springs, gardens, forests, flowers, fruits, and so forth.
Illusory objects have no perception or cognition, nor do they have a place to abide;
They are ultimately in a state of quiescent extinction, only manifesting in accordance with discrimination.
Bodhisattvas are able to universally see all worlds in this way,
And understand that all existent and non-existent phenomena are like illusions.
Sentient beings and lands are created by various karmic actions;
Entering the realm of illusions, there is no attachment to them.
In this way, attaining skillful means, quiescent extinction, and freedom from conceptual proliferation,
Abiding in the stage of unobstructedness, universally manifesting great spiritual powers.
The courageous Buddha's disciples, in accordance with the subtle Dharma,
Skillfully observe all conceptual thoughts that entangle and ensnare the world.
Conceptual thoughts are like mirages, causing sentient beings to misunderstand,
Bodhisattvas skillfully understand conceptualization and abandon all inversions.
Sentient beings are each different, with various forms and types,
Fully understanding that they are all conceptualizations, all without true reality.
The sentient beings of the ten directions are all covered by conceptualization,
If they abandon inverted views, they will extinguish the conceptualization of the world.
The world is like a mirage, with distinctions due to conceptualization,
Knowing that the world abides in conceptualization, one is free from the three inversions.
Just as in the heat of summer, a mirage is seen and taken to be water,
Water is actually non-existent, the wise should not seek it.
Sentient beings are also like this, the destinies of the world are all non-existent,
Like a mirage abiding in conceptualization, the realm of the unobstructed mind.
If one is free from all conceptualizations, one is also free from all idle discourse,
Those foolishly attached to conceptualization are all caused to attain liberation.
Far from the mind of arrogance, eliminating worldly thoughts,
Abiding in the place of exhaustion and non-exhaustion, this is the skillful means of the bodhisattva.
The bodhisattva understands that worldly dharmas are all like dreams,
Not a place, not a non-place, the essence is always quiescent and extinct.
All dharmas are without discrimination, like a dream not different from the mind,
The worlds of the three times are all like this.
The essence of a dream is without birth or cessation, and also has no location,
The three realms are all like this, the one who sees attains mental liberation.
A dream is not in the world, nor is it outside the world,
Not discriminating these two, one enters the stage of acceptance.
Just as in a dream one sees various different appearances,
The world is also like this, no different from a dream.
The one who abides in the samÄdhi of dreams understands the world to be all like a dream,
Not the same and not different, not one and not various.
Sentient beings, lands, karma, defilement and purity,
All are thoroughly understood to be equal to dreams.
The practices and great vows undertaken by bodhisattvas,
Are clearly all like dreams, and no different from the world.
Understanding the world to be empty and still, without destroying worldly dharmas,
It is like seeing long and short colors in a dream.
This is called the forbearance of being like a dream. Based on this, one understands worldly dharmas,
Quickly attaining unobstructed cognition, widely liberating all beings.
Cultivating such practices, giving rise to vast understanding,
Skillfully understanding the nature of dharmas, the mind has no attachment to dharmas.
All the various sounds in the world,
Are neither internal nor external, understood to be all like echoes.
Just as various echoes are heard, yet the mind does not give rise to discrimination;
When bodhisattvas hear sounds, their minds are also like this.
Gazing up at the tathÄgatas and listening to the sound of the Dharma being spoken,
Expounding the sÅ«tras immeasurably, although they hear, they are unattached.
Like an echo that has no place of origin, the sounds that are heard are also like this,
Yet they are able to discriminate the Dharma, without contradicting the Dharma.
Skillfully understanding all sounds, yet not discriminating sounds,
Knowing that sounds are all empty and quiescent, universally emitting pure sounds.
Knowing that the Dharma is not in words, skillfully entering the realm of no words,
Yet able to manifest speech, like an echo pervading the world.
Understanding the path of language, fully endowed with the aspects of sound,
Knowing that the nature of sound is empty and quiescent, speaking with worldly sounds.
Just as there are sounds in the world, demonstrating the discrimination of the Dharma in the same way,
That sound pervades everywhere, Awakening all sentient beings.
Bodhisattvas who attain this forbearance, With pure sound transform the world,
Skillfully speaking of the three times, Yet without attachment to the world.
In order to benefit the world, They single-mindedly seek enlightenment,
And always enter the nature of dharmas, Without discrimination towards it.
Universally observing all worlds, Quiescent extinction without inherent nature,
Yet always benefiting, Practicing without a wavering mind.
Not dwelling in the world, Yet not apart from the world,
In the world there is nothing to rely on, The basis cannot be found.
Understanding the nature of the world, Yet without attachment to that nature,
Although not relying on the world, Transforming the world to transcend it.
The dharmas that exist in the world, All knowing their intrinsic nature,
Understanding dharmas to be non-dual, Non-duality also has no attachment.
The mind does not leave the world, nor does it dwell in the world,
Not outside the world, cultivating omniscience.
Just as a reflection in water is neither internal nor external,
Bodhisattvas seeking enlightenment understand the world is not the world.
Not dwelling in or emerging from the world, because the world cannot be spoken of,
Also not inside or outside, like a reflection appearing in the world.
Entering this profound meaning, free from defilements, all is clear and penetrating,
Not abandoning the mind of original vows, universally illuminating the lamp of wisdom.
The world has no boundaries, wisdom enters and is equal to all,
Universally transforming all beings, causing them to abandon all attachments.
Observing the profound Dharma, benefiting the multitude of beings,
From here entering into wisdom, cultivating all paths.
Bodhisattvas observe all dharmas, discerning them all to be like apparitions,
And practice like an illusion, never abandoning it ultimately.
In accordance with the nature of illusions, cultivating the path to enlightenment,
All phenomena are like illusions, and the bodhisattva's practice is also so.
All worlds and immeasurable karmic actions,
Are all equal to illusions, ultimately abiding in quiescence.
The buddhas of the three times are also all like illusions,
Cultivating practices through their original vows, transforming into tathÄgatas.
The Buddha, with great compassion, liberates illusory sentient beings,
Liberation is also like an illusion, using illusory power to expound the Dharma.
Knowing that the world is all like an illusion, not discriminating the world,
Illusory events are various and distinct, all due to the differences in karma.
Cultivating the practices of enlightenment, adorning the treasury of illusions,
Immeasurable good adornments, like karma creating the world.
The Dharma of transformation is free from discrimination, and also does not discriminate the Dharma,
These two are both quiescent and extinguished, the bodhisattva practices like this.
The ocean of transformation understands wisdom, the nature of transformation seals the world,
Transformation is not a dharma of arising and ceasing, wisdom is also like this.
The tenth forbearance illuminates observation, sentient beings and all dharmas,
Their essence is all quiescent and extinguished, like space with no location.
Obtaining this wisdom like space, forever free from all grasping and attachment,
Like space with no variety, unobstructed in the world.
Accomplishing the power of the forbearance of space, like space with no end,
The realm is like empty space, not making discriminations of emptiness.
Empty space has no inherent nature, and also is not cut off and extinguished,
Also no various distinctions, the power of wisdom is also like this.
Empty space has no initial limit, and also no middle or end,
The extent of which cannot be apprehended, the bodhisattva's wisdom is also like this.
Thus contemplating the nature of dharmas, all are like empty space,
